title: Fire Island National Seashore: Plan A Field Trip
body: Plan A Field Trip     Make Fire Island Your Outdoor Classroom Enhance your educational program with a hands-on learning experience at Fire Island National Seashore. You may arrange a visit to Fire Island by ferry in the fall or spring, or get to Fire Island Lighthouse, Fire Island Wilderness, or William Floyd Estate by bus year-round. Call ahead and schedule a volunteer- or ranger-led program, or ask for free materials to enrich your self-guided tour.   For More Information   Download our Educator's Resource Guide for background on Fire Island, field trip planning tips, and a list of our free lesson plans. To plan your Fire Island Lighthouse visit, call the Fire Island Lighthouse Preservation Society at 631-661-4876. Call 631-687-4780 to learn more about visiting Sailors Haven, Watch Hill, and Otis Pike Fire Island High Dune Wilderness. To schedule visits to the William Floyd Estate call 631-399-2030.
